question: Among the following 0.1 m aqueous solutions, which one will exhibit the lowest boiling point elevation, assuming complete ionization of the compound in solution?
explanation: Boiling point elevation depends on van't Hoff factor (i). NaCl (i=2), K2SO4 (i=3), AlCl3 (i=4), Al2(SO4)3 (i=5). NaCl has the lowest 'i', thus lowest elevation [cite: 1023-1029].
